snippet: No measure since King Salman ascended the throne has caused as much buzz as the post-coronation giveaway that will cost an estimated $32 billion.
abstract: Saudi Arabian King Salman has ordered over $32 billion in payouts to large portion of population after ascending to throne in January 2015; payouts, symbol of good will, come amid drop in oil prices and are projected to increase government's deficit to record $44.5 billion in 2015, which new spending might bump up to $67.2 billion, or 9 percent of Saudi gross domestic product.
lead_paragraph: No measure since King Salman ascended the throne has caused as much buzz as the post-coronation giveaway that will cost an estimated $32 billion.

headline.main: Saudi King Unleashes a Torrent of Money as Bonuses Flow to the Masses
headline.print_headline: Saudi King Unleashes a Torrent as Bonuses Flow to the Masses
